sources.title: Docling: Document AI for Enterprise - GitHub Repository
sources.synthesis: Open-source document parsing library with vision-based layout analysis, table extraction to markdown, and OCR capabilities. Supports deterministic offline mode via model caching and CPU-only execution. Version 0.12.0 tested for ESG report processing with proven structure preservation.

sources.title: PyMuPDF Documentation - Text Extraction Methods
sources.synthesis: Baseline PDF text extraction library using MuPDF engine. Supports fast page-level text extraction via get_text() method. Limited to text-only output with no structure preservation or table parsing. Version 1.24.10 provides stable API compatible with Docling integration.

sources.title: SCA v13.8 Protocol - Authenticity Invariants & MEA
sources.synthesis: Defines determinism requirements (fixed seeds, pinned dependencies), CP gate specifications (TDD, ≥95% coverage, failure tests), and authenticity validation rules (no mocks, real computation, honest status reporting). Mandates Mandatory Execution Algorithm for autonomous write-validate-fix cycles.

sources.title: prospecting-engine Phase E→F Closeout Report
sources.synthesis: Documents successful page-aware PDF extraction implementation with provenance tracking. Achieved triple deterministic validation (3/3 runs identical) across 5 companies. Established evidence gates requiring ≥2-3 distinct pages per theme. Provides baseline for Docling integration comparison and parity validation.

sources.title: Transformers Library - Deterministic Training
sources.synthesis: Provides guidance on achieving reproducible results with transformer models via torch.manual_seed(), torch.use_deterministic_algorithms(), and CUDA configuration. Critical for ensuring Docling's vision models produce deterministic outputs across runs. Recommends CPU-only mode for guaranteed reproducibility.

synthesis_guidelines.validation: All sources verified accessible as of 2025-10-30
